intro: Eurychaenia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty eurychaenia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish-brown stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to brown, with five petals and numerous stamens. Eurychaenia ferruginea is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
